reviews.review_msg: The instructions and communication from the teaching team are most unclear.They'll butcher your assignment and deduct marks based on personal preference.The rubric is just eye candy.Avoid taking this course with her, you'll gain nothing but a sorry grade.Hands down the most unfriendly and nitpicky markers I've dealt with in years.NOT A GPA BOOSTER.
She is not a great professor, very strict and does NOT teach just makes you go to break out rooms

Interesting course content. Grading criteria was not clear, the TAs and teacher were not on the same page for the marking or what they wanted to see for the assignments. I took this class in intercession, and it was so much reading, video watching, and note taking. Quizzes were pretty easy, I got a good group, and my TA marked decently. GPA booster

Awful proof
easy class
 really easy, but the prof is horrible
gives terrible guidance for assignments and when asked about what shes expecting she wants something to wow her and it's like worth 5% and she'll give 4.75 or some ridiculous number
and now explain why its not full marks
Without using derogatory language i'd just say she is not pleasant

Be ready to read a lot! The instructions are so unclear that I went to office hour 3-4 times over 1 assignment because they never could give clear instructions. They never go over the assignment they assume you understand it just by reading it. Weekly Group Assignments based of the readings/ lectures, weekly quizzes, peer evaluations per week

Rebecca and her TA did a great job in organizing the intersession summer course. As long as you luck out with a great group, you'll do fine. Some marking for individual assignments werent clear - resulting in a low grade, however the group project and easy weekly quizzes make up for it. Definitely recommend !!

Really unclear about what's going to be on the tests. Random information that wasn't even mentioned in lectures was on the tests. Paper was all over the place without clarification on how to integrate material.

Don't take this course with her. The guidelines for the tests and the paper were all unclear and confusing. For her tests, she questions you on a random line in the book that she did not even mention in her lectures. The paper instructions were unclear, and I didn't know if I was integrating the materials into the paper in the right way

The exams are hard in that she expects you to apply the material and not just memorize, but it's not anywhere as bad as people make it out to be. Distance ed format isn't ideal if you like a lot of engagement with your prof, but if you're more of a self-directed learner, it's fine. Focus on key findings from studies and overarching concepts/themes

this class was more so boring than hard. The lectures are not engaging at all. You don't hear from the prof at all. The paper is so dumb with the pointless peer review process. The exams are also very hard the avg for the first mid-term was 60%. Focus on what she says during the lecture and remember important studies.

Questions and information about the exams and assignment came from the TA and the only time you hear from Cobb is when you watch the pre-recorded lectures. The exams focuses on applying the material and understanding the readings. They are an hour long and has MC and short answers, but the MC take so long to read. It's time consuming and hard work.

super average experience and lectures were the worst thing ever. 12% free for just doing Quiz's (no limits) and 6% for peer review. Those helped a lot. it's manageable, but if you have other choices, i'd go for those. But if you don't, it's not too bad. Do the work, and make notes on ALL the readings (I suggest splitting with classmates).

I've taken this course twice now and cant get more than a D because of how difficult the exams are. So many of the questions are not even course related and it's impossible to get good marks in the exams. 
Would not recommend it.

This class isn't as bad as the reviews make it seem. I found the midterms super fair and easy and there's a lot of free marks in the quizzes. But the final was absolutely ridiculous. Very wordy and tested on concepts that weren't in course material. Overall, I wouldn't avoid Dr. Cobb just because of the bad reviews, just be prepared to work hard.

The course is interesting and easy but the professor is not. she tries her level best to create questions and scenarios in her exams that make it impossible for students (guessing game), questions aren't found in the textbook, lecture videos or readings. if you do not want psychological trauma and PTSD please avoid the class at all costs. esp Cobb

Literally worst professor + course I've had. She clearly doesn't care about her students at all and whole course sets students up for failure. MCQ exams don't even test your knowledge of the material- only on things like whether you can remember a random study in the book. It's a shame that such interesting course material is executed so horribly.

You have no interaction with the prof. Test are about recall, because it's 90% MC, and you have roughly 1 minute a mark. Questions are WORDY. You will get questions that weren't in lecture or readings. Video audio is all over the place and contains dead links. Course has interesting material, but evaluation is done extremely poorly. Do not take.

I took this class because I thought the content was going to be interesting! Some stuff was interesting to learn but the Professor really does not care about how well her students do and learning in general. Honestly, it was SUPER disappointing after enjoying some aspects of this class from psyc 260 and do not recommend it to anyone. AVOID IT!

Midterms in this class test you on specific studies she barely mentions. Super detailed questions, with super tricky answers that seem designed to mess you up. The lecture videos are formatted differently, and very low quality that sometimes the audio just cuts out. Do not take this class or any class with Rebecca for that matter.

The online class was terrible. Everything in the exams was worded weirdly, and it was done INTENTIONAL. It's almost like the prof doesn't want us to apply our knowledge, but to solve riddles. You have to remember all the minor details of videos/textbooks/readings/lectures and do all that in 1 hour. Also, TA's are unreachable before/during exams.

Worst professor I have ever taken a class with and that's coming from a fourth year Dean's List student. Her midterm/final are impossible and draw on specific, unrelated concepts. She gives you one hour for a midterm with highly specific questions. You won't get to finish. If you see any good reviews of her and her class, she wrote it herself LOL

The course is not that hard, but yea, the prof had no idea how to deliver all the knowledge to her students. Broken lectures, no slides provided and everything sound ambiguous. The exam is full of applications and confusing and ends up with a 56% average. AVOID.

Rebecca's class was good. I don't understand the uproar; I didn't find her course that hard. The level of difficulty was avg compared to other courses. Her exams, especially the short answer really helps you practice applying the material to real-life situations. If you stay on top of your readings, take good notes, and don't cram - you will be ok.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! The sound in the lecture videos constantly cuts out and is very disengaging. You can know the material and concepts front to back but if you don't memorize random facts that she mentioned once that have nothing to do with knowing the material then you're not likely to do well on the exams.

This is the worst course I have taken at SFU. Her lectures are long, boring, and confusing. Her tests are very hard and focus on the most specific and irrelevant details which makes studying nearly impossible. She is way too picky with marking. It seems like she assumes that her course is the only thing that matters. TERRIBLE PROF.

As a third year student, I must say this is the worst course I've taken. I am not somebody to bash a prof, but this one is hard to ignore. I would not recommend this prof at all. The sound quality is not good on lecture videos, she is not clear on many concepts and the exam questions are not well designed based on the videos/readings.

She doesnt support her students. I emailed her looking for support, seeking guidance when I was having a difficult time and was brushed aside. She does not care for student success, only her own image.

She is a very good teacher. Don't listen to the comments below. Her class isn't all that hard as long as you put work into it like any other kind of class you take. She gives hints in lectures of what will be on the test. Focus on the big points in the lecture and are highlighted in the textbook. Uni life involves work, you just gotta work hard.

Probably the worst class/prof I have had. Test were not even on her lectures, it was instead based on random uncovered things from the test. So read the textbook, but wait! You MUST attend the useless lectures because of participation (10%). The paper helps boost your grade. But the test are difficult.

Very insensitive professor, she is all business.  Will dock you for being sick with a note or for having family emergencies. Not a very inclusive professor. All her studies focus on heterosexual, upper-middle class white people. Also a very tough marker. Take this class if you are prepared to bust your butt.

The prof did a very bad job in grading. She is very strict grader and her own research contradict itself. Even though she teaches close relationship, she does not have one herself. I HATE THIS PROF. Too much generalization

Very accessible.   Class does cover research, but not extensive that it becomes overwhelming.  Very organized lecturer and definitely to get a good grasp of material is to read the textbook.  Fair tests, need to read carefully to the multiple choice questions as they can get tricky.    Fun interactive class, but you need to put in some work.
No Comments
